measured_by: discount rate km parameter (preference-uncertainty KU model)
justification: “We applied computational models of hyperbolic discounting… The free parameters in the chosen model, km (temporal impulsivity)… exhibited excellent parameter recovery.”
“The free parameters in the chosen model, km (temporal impulsivity) and ku (preference uncertainty), representing the mean and standard deviation of the participant's discounting distribution…”
“We examined their susceptibility to social influence using signed KL divergence (DKL)… We used DKL to formally quantify the shift of model parameters due to social influence.”
“The Apathy Motivation Index, a scale consisting of 18 items, was used to assess participants' apathetic traits.”
“Symptoms of depression were assessed through the 21-item Beck Depression Inventory (BDI).”
“In TMT-A, participants… connect 25 numbers… serving as a test of visual attention.”
“TMT-B requires participants to alternate between numbers and letters… which is considered a measure of executive function.”
“Participants were presented questions to assess their perceived similarity to others… using a sliding scale ranging from 0 (not at all) to 10 (very similar).”
